projects.title: NEU EXPO
projects.subtitle: Northeastern University Exhibition Center
projects.description: Managed comprehensive closeout process for Northeastern University's Exhibition Center curtain wall project in Roxbury, Boston. Joined Island Exterior Fabricators during the final stages to ensure quality completion, documentation, and successful client handover for this $45M curtain wall scope.
projects.scope: Project closeout management including punchlist approval and submission, preparation of closeout documentation, finalization of warranties and terms & conditions, and coordination of project handover to the client. Worked collaboratively with Project Manager to ensure complete and compliant project delivery.
projects.challenges: Joining during late-stage closeout required quickly understanding complex curtain wall systems and prior project history. Managing detailed punchlist items across 45,000 sq ft of curtain wall while coordinating with multiple stakeholders for documentation and warranty finalization. Ensuring all closeout requirements met client expectations and contractual obligations.
projects.solutions: Developed systematic approach to punchlist management, tracking each item from identification through completion. Created comprehensive closeout documentation package including warranties, operation manuals, and as-built drawings. Coordinated closely with Project Manager and client representatives to ensure smooth handover and client satisfaction.

projects.title: First National Bank
projects.subtitle: First National Bank Headquarters
projects.description: Led the successful completion of First National Bank's headquarters curtain wall project in Pittsburgh as a takeover from another subcontractor. Managed the completion of 120 remaining reglazes, coordinated new glass procurement and strategic logistics, led 9+ critical testing procedures, and ensured timely delivery to meet the client's Temporary Certificate of Occupancy deadline for this $300M facility.
projects.scope: Takeover project management including completion of 120 remaining reglazes, resolution of unpaid vendor issues, procurement and logistics coordination of new glass materials, strategic sequencing of deliveries to maximize installation efficiency, leadership of 9+ testing procedures with remediation of identified issues, door ordering and installation, and coordination with client to achieve Temporary Certificate of Occupancy deadline.
projects.challenges: Inheriting a project with incomplete work and unpaid vendors required quickly establishing credibility and new vendor relationships. Managing the complex logistics of glass delivery sequencing across 120 reglaze locations to minimize installation downtime and overhead costs. Leading 9+ tests while studying previous failure reports to identify and remediate leak sources. Coordinating multiple work streams under tight TCO deadline pressure while maintaining quality standards on a $20M curtain wall scope within a $300M total project.
projects.solutions: Systematically cleared vendor dues and established reliable new supplier relationships. Developed strategic glass ordering and delivery sequence plan that maximized installation efficiency and minimized downtime. Led comprehensive testing program, analyzing previous test reports to identify root causes of leaks and collaborating with internal technical teams to implement permanent fixes. Coordinated door procurement and installation alongside reglaze work. Successfully delivered all scope items on schedule to meet client's TCO deadline.

specifications.systemType: Curtain Wall System with Reglaze Completion

projects.title: FM Global Headquarters
projects.subtitle: Corporate Campus Facade System
projects.description: Managed comprehensive stick-built curtain wall installation for FM Global's corporate headquarters in Norwood, MA. Oversaw 1,900 linear ft of system installation with full QA/QC protocols, coordinated water testing and leak remediation, created and resolved NCRs, and led on-site union labor coordination using detailed drawings and 3D models. Managed RFIs, generated Change Orders, and maintained continuous design team collaboration to ensure alignment between design intent and field conditions for this $593M corporate campus with $50M curtain wall scope.
projects.scope: Comprehensive stick-built curtain wall installation management including 1,900 linear ft of system installation, weather sealing verification through QA/QC protocols, coordination and execution of water testing procedures, leak investigation and remediation, NCR creation and resolution, on-site union labor management and training using sketched drawings and 3D models, RFI management, Change Order generation, schedule coordination, and regular design team collaboration to bridge gaps between as-designed and as-built conditions across 85,000 sq ft of curtain wall area.
projects.challenges: Managing 1,900 linear ft of stick-built installation required meticulous attention to weather sealing and quality control. Coordinating water testing revealed multiple leak sources requiring systematic investigation and NCR documentation. Working with union labor required clear communication of complex installation sequences using visual aids. Bridging the gap between design intent and actual site conditions demanded continuous coordination with design team. Maintaining schedule while addressing quality issues and generating necessary Change Orders for scope updates across this large-scale $50M curtain wall scope within a $593M corporate campus project.
projects.solutions: Implemented comprehensive QA/QC protocols ensuring weather sealing integrity across all 1,900 linear ft of stick-built installation. Developed systematic approach to water testing, leak identification, and remediation with detailed NCR documentation and root cause analysis. Created effective communication strategy using sketched drawings and 3D models to train and coordinate union labor force. Established regular design coordination meetings to proactively address constructability issues and site condition variations. Managed RFI and Change Order processes efficiently to keep project on schedule while maintaining quality standards and meeting FM Global's stringent corporate requirements.

projects.title: Agile Construction Project Management
projects.subtitle: Best Practices and Case Studies
projects.description: Master's thesis research exploring Agile Project Management as a transformative framework for construction projects. Demonstrated how Agile's iterative, customer-centric approach improves communication, adaptability, and efficiency across teams while addressing integration challenges. Through global case studies (U.S., Macau, Iraq), concluded that Agile can significantly enhance construction management performance when adapted to industry-specific conditions.
projects.scope: Graduate-level research thesis for Master of Science in Project Management at Boston University. Comprehensive analysis of Agile methodologies in construction through literature review, comparative case studies across three international projects, and synthesis of best practices for industry adoption. Research examined stakeholder collaboration, iterative planning frameworks, and hybrid implementation models.
projects.challenges: Adapting software development methodologies (Agile) to the traditionally sequential construction industry presented conceptual and practical challenges. Analyzing diverse international case studies required reconciling different regulatory environments, cultural contexts, and project scales. Identifying barriers to Agile adoption including cultural resistance, training requirements, and integration with established Waterfall methodologies. Synthesizing empirical evidence with theoretical frameworks to produce actionable recommendations.
projects.solutions: Developed comparative framework analyzing Agile implementation across three distinct construction projects in different countries. Synthesized existing literature with empirical case study data to identify patterns and best practices. Proposed hybrid Agileâ€“Waterfall models that leverage strengths of both methodologies. Identified digital twin technology and modern collaboration tools as enablers for Agile adoption. Created actionable recommendations for construction firms considering Agile transformation, emphasizing change management, stakeholder buy-in, and iterative implementation strategies.

specifications.advisors: Prof. Richard Maltzman, Prof. Anil Sawhney
